string.text: Standard button cell battery. Widely used by stalkers to charge various devices.
Metal fastening device in the form of a rod with external threading and a hexagonal head for a wrench. Used by stalkers to detect, delineate anomalies, and discharge them, as well as to detect mines.
Standard repair kit. Allows repair of equipment if you know what you're doing.

This setting adjusts the amount by which the maximum visibility distance set in the current weather profile is multiplied. For example, if the weather has a visibility range of 150 meters, at the minimum slider position, you will see up to 60 meters, and at the maximum, up to 225. \n\n %c[pda_yellow] • Load: Medium

This setting adjusts the level of detail in rendering and lighting of human, monster, and weapon models in the game. The further the slider, the more detailed they will be. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low
This setting adjusts how densely grass tufts are rendered in the game. The further the slider, the closer together grass elements will be rendered, making it denser. \n\n %c[pda_red] • Load: High

This setting adjusts the maximum distance at which grass is rendered. The further the slider, the farther the edge of the grass will be. WARNING! The game's grass rendering algorithm means that increasing the grass radius exponentially increases the load on the graphics card. Reasonable values lie within the range of 150-200 meters. \n\n %c[pda_red] • Load: High

This setting adjusts the level of detail in the game's textures. The further the slider, the clearer the textures and the more video memory they require. Lowering this setting will blur the textures but consume less memory. \n\n %c[pda_yellow] • Load: Medium
This setting adjusts the degree of anisotropic filtering of textures. The higher the value, the sharper textures will appear as the distance to them increases. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low
This setting enables bullet hit marks on NPC bodies. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low
This setting enables objects to cast shadows from sunlight. Disabling this setting on low-end PCs can significantly increase performance. \n\n %c[pda_yellow] • Load: Medium

This setting enables grass to cast shadows from sunlight and other sources of dynamic lighting. WARNING! This setting significantly impacts performance. Do not use it with large grass render radius or high grass density! \n\n %c[pda_red] • Load: VERY HIGH

This setting adjusts the accuracy of lighting calculations as the distance to them increases. The higher it is, the more detailed shadows from dynamic light sources will appear at a distance. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low

This setting allows the game to process volumetric light from NPC torches. Disabling this setting on low-end PCs can significantly increase performance at night, especially in camps with many NPCs. \n\n %c[pda_yellow] • Load: Medium
This setting adjusts the quality of shadow rendering in the game. The higher it is, the smoother the edges of shadows will be. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low

This setting enables vertical synchronization, i.e., synchronizing the frame rate with the monitor's refresh rate. Enabling it eliminates the slight horizontal screen tearing effect during rapid mouse movements but may slightly reduce performance. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low

This setting forces the game to always use a video mode with a 60Hz refresh rate. This setting is useful for owners of monitors where the game incorrectly detects the screen refresh rate at startup. However, it is recommended to enable this setting only if you have this problem. In some rare cases, enabling this setting may cause lag in fullscreen mode. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low
This setting allows you to enable or disable additional anti-aliasing. Additional anti-aliasing works simultaneously with the main (MSAA). Or without it, as the main. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low

This setting switches the type of sunshafts. Choose the one you prefer. 

 %c[pda_green] • Screen Space: Low Load
 %c[pda_red] • Volumetric: High Load
 %c[pda_red] • Combined: High Load

This setting enables the softening effect on the edge of water surfaces. When enabled, water at the edge of bodies of water will smoothly fade to transparency, eliminating the sharp and highly noticeable boundary between water and land. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low

This setting enables the soft particles effect. When enabled, effects such as fire, smoke, explosions, sparks, etc., will greatly improve in appearance. It is recommended to always keep this setting enabled. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low

This setting allows you to adjust the quality of global illumination in the game. When enabled, this effect calculates additional geometry shading of models, making lighting more realistic by adding semi-shadows and shading from equipment, clothing, vehicle details, and other small geometry parts. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low
This setting adjusts the operation mode of the global illumination effect in the game. \n\n %c[pda_yellow] • Load: Medium

This setting adjusts the enhanced surface relief effect using the Steep parallax mapping algorithm. This algorithm uses ray tracing in the height map space to calculate relief, resulting in a more realistic and high-quality effect. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low
This setting enables the depth of field effect - real-time focus adjustment. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low
This setting enables Detailed Bump - displaying fine details and roughness on objects. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low
This setting enables raindrops on helmet and gas mask glass during rain. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low
Enables surfaces to get wet during rain. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low
This setting enables volumetric light for some lamps. \n\n %c[pda_yellow] • Load: Medium
This setting allows you to adjust the quality of reflections from water and wet surfaces or turn them off. \n\n %c[pda_yellow] • Load: Medium
This setting enables volumetric fog technology. It is used to simulate murky water, mist in lowlands, and similar effects. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low
This setting enables the shadow from the main character. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low

The higher the shadow map resolution, the sharper distant shadows will be. It is recommended to set the resolution no lower than 4096x4096. This setting significantly affects performance. \n\n %c[pda_red] • Load: VERY HIGH
Activates simultaneous loading of textures by multiple threads. May slightly reduce save loading time with an SSD. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low
It makes sense to increase the field of view for widescreen monitors and depending on individual preferences. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low

Player's field of view. If the value, for example, is 0.45 or lower, the weapon will appear closer; if the value is 0.65 or higher, the weapon during gameplay will appear farther away. It makes sense to adjust individually for widescreen monitors and depending on FOV. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low
This setting allows you to change the MSAA multiplier. WARNING! High values can significantly reduce performance. It is recommended to set the multiplier to 4x. \n\n %c[pda_red] • Load: High
This setting allows you to change the height of the grass. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low

This option enables static shadows from the sun. When this option is enabled, shadows will not change their size and orientation depending on the sun's position in the sky. It can significantly increase FPS on weak PCs. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low
This setting allows you to select the mode of operation of glare from light sources on the camera or disable them. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low
This setting allows you to forcibly disable the use of bump maps in the game. The geometry quality will be lower, but it will slightly increase performance. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low
This setting allows you to adjust the quality of the sun. \n\n %c[pda_yellow] • Load: Medium
This setting allows you to adjust the quality of sunshafts. \n\n %c[pda_yellow] • Load: Medium
This setting allows you to adjust the distance of reflections. Values from 300 to 500 meters are recommended. \n\n %c[pda_red] • Load: High

This option enables or disables tessellation. Tessellation algorithms allow breaking down one primitive, for example, a triangle, into several according to a certain law, making the geometry look smoother. \n\n %c[pda_yellow] • Load: Medium
This setting allows you to choose the type of lowland fog. Either the native one from G.S.W.R. or from the Screen Space Shaders add-on. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low
This setting enables or disables 3D scopes in the game. This option will not work with original weapons. \n\n %c[pda_red] • Load: High
This option enables or disables the 3D PDA. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low
This option enables or disables the vignette effect. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low
This option enables or disables the dynamic effect of helmet or gas mask glass on the screen. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low

This option enables or disables dynamic effects on the screen. With this effect enabled, the screen will redden at the edges when health decreases, darken when stamina decreases, etc. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low
This setting enables or disables the shader effect of night vision devices. If the option is disabled, the original effect is used. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low
This setting enables or disables the motion blur effect in sharp movements. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low
This option allows you to adjust the intensity of the motion blur effect in sharp movements. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low

This option allows you to adjust the optimization of static geometry (locations). This option significantly degrades the picture by disabling all geometry at a distance, but for weak PCs, it can be a solution to low performance. The further the slider, the closer the cutoff boundary of static geometry. When the value is zero, the effect is disabled. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low

This option allows you to adjust the optimization of dynamic geometry (crates, barrels, NPCs, etc.). The further the slider, the closer the cutoff boundary of dynamic geometry. When the value is zero, the effect is disabled. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low
This option allows you to enable or disable shadow optimization. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low
This setting allows you to adjust the intensity of the red color for color correction. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low
This setting allows you to adjust the intensity of the green color for color correction. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low
This setting allows you to adjust the intensity of the blue color for color correction. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low
This setting allows you to adjust the color saturation for color correction. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low
This option allows you to select the type of lighting. Static lighting is suitable for weak PCs, and dynamic lighting is for more powerful ones.
This option allows you to select a ready-made settings preset. High settings may reduce performance. It is recommended to manually adjust the settings.
This option allows you to set the screen resolution in the game. It is recommended to set the resolution corresponding to the monitor.
This setting allows you to select a ready-made color correction setting.

This setting allows you to adjust the maximum permissible number of sound sources. The more sources, the less likely clicks and crackles in places where a large number of sounds are played simultaneously. Usually, these are anomaly zones.
This option enables or disables the use of surround sound effects. If the option is enabled, echo can be heard in some rooms.
This option enables or disables dynamic music in the game. This is music that starts playing during combat with enemies.
This option enables or disables sound delay. The further the sound from the camera, the longer it will take to play back.

This option enables sound caching. When enabled, all sounds will be loaded at the start of the game. The game startup speed to the main menu increases, but the likelihood of freezes during NPC loading decreases in the game.
This option allows you to adjust the type of crosshair on the screen.
If this option is enabled, the crosshair will change size depending on the distance to the object it points to.
This setting enables or disables the enhanced crosshair, which moves along with changes in the direction of the weapon barrel.
This setting enables or disables weapon collision in the hands of the hero. If the option is enabled, the hero will remove the weapon from obstacles.

This setting enables or disables corpse collision. If the option is enabled, corpses become a real obstacle and the main character cannot pass through them. WARNING! This option may cause pathfinding issues in enclosed spaces.
This option enables the simulation of walking inertia for the hero. That is, when we move forward and stop, the camera will still move forward slightly and then move back to its original position.
This setting enables or disables loading stages of the game on the loading screen.

This option allows you to adjust the number of quick saves. If the option value is greater than 0, saves are created with a sequential number. When quick saving reaches the ceiling specified in the option, it starts overwriting old saves. It is strongly recommended to set the maximum possible number of quick saves.
This option enables the application of grass by the hero and characters. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low
This option enables the chromatic aberration effect in the game. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low
This option enables the film grain effect in the game. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low
This option enables the Screen Space Shaders add-on. \n\n %c[pda_red] • Load: High
This option smooths out sky textures, making transitions between pixels smoother. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low
This option improves the interaction of bushes, branches, and grass with lighting, as well as fixes flaws. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low
This option activates support for lowland fog from Screen Space Shaders. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low
This option enables indirect lighting, which, when hitting a surface, reflects from it in different directions, thereby illuminating other surfaces around. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low
This option adds shadows to weapons and small details. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low
This option enables shadow offset from Screen Space Shaders 19. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low

This option enables the influence of wind on grass and trees from Screen Space Shaders 19. If you enable this option, the wind influence from Advanced X-Ray will be disabled. \n\n %c[pda_green] • Load: Low
This option enables the Enchanted Shaders add-on. \n\n %c[pda_yellow] • Load: Medium
This option allows you to adjust the camera behavior during the hero's death.
This option contributes to improving the game's graphics, making it more realistic and beautiful. \n\n %c[pda_yellow] • Load: Medium
This option allows you to adjust the radius of the surface wetting effect during rain. \n\n %c[pda_yellow] • Load: Medium
This option enables the implementation of pseudo PBR. Allows you to achieve beautiful highlights on textures, but does not always look good. \n\n %c[pda_yellow] • Load: Medium

This setting allows you to limit the maximum frame rate in the game. This allows for a more stable game display and reduces the load on hardware and system resources, providing a smoother and more comfortable gaming experience.

The lead-insulated metal artifact container is a simple metal box with thick walls lined with foam, as well as a heavy lid with sealing rubber. Designed specifically for transporting artifacts. The special solution containing the artifact retains its anomalous energy, and the tightness and lead lining allow blocking all negative radiation emanating from the artifacts, thereby ensuring user safety. However, it cannot be attached to the belt - this means that it blocks both the positive properties of the artifacts and the negative ones.
A reliable companion for those who value accuracy and reliability in the world of marksmanship.
This option allows you to adjust the shadow rendering radius of grass. Lowering the value can gain some FPS. \n\n %c[pda_yellow] • Load: Medium
